channel.title: Question

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

Night26:

you dont want to use get statements for dynamic images, because forums wont accept them. You have to just string split the url address.

they do accept them
u just gotta trick them
http://train.cruels.net/aimstatus/aimstatus.php/username.gif
the php script can get the part after the .php
remove the / and .gif
and is left with username

ok so maybe its not a get variable exactly…but it gets the job done

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

if you mean you want the the name in the url then you would make a list of servers with links and when some one clicks into one it would bring up a page telling you whether its up or not? then you just use a GET statment go and look in the tut list for
a tutorial on it if you son’t know how to use it or go to http://www.php.net/variables.external

or am i having a thick day and you just want it to show a image if its up or down?

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @InfoManiac InfoManiac
item.description:
@InfoManiac wrote:

Ok, how would I make it so when I make a server status is can show up in image tags?

I know is has to be like

www.url.com/status.php?servernamehere

I just don’t know how to code it… Any help is GREATLY appreciated…

This is a basic Status thing…

[code]<?php
$checkCHAR = @fsockopen(‘IP’, ‘PORT’, $ERRNO, $ERRSTR, 1);
if($checkCHAR) {

echo (’’);

} else {

echo (’’); }
?>[/code]

Read full topic
